meanings.definition: To join together in a union or alliance.
meanings.sent1: The workers unionised to negotiate better pay and benefits.
meanings.sent2: The employees unionised to have a stronger voice in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The ants unionised to gather food more efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The students unionised to form a study group for exams.
meanings.sent5: The birds unionised to migrate south for the winter.

meanings.sent1: The unionised workers went on strike for fair wages.
meanings.sent2: The unionised employees had better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The unionised bees demanded more honey for their hard work.
meanings.sent4: The unionised team won better benefits through negotiations.
meanings.sent5: The unionised group stood together for their rights.

meanings.sent1: The unionised colors of the flag represented unity.
meanings.sent2: The unionised policies ensured fairness for all.
meanings.sent3: The unionised flavors of the cake pleased everyone's taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The unionised schedule kept everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The unionised design of the building was aesthetically pleasing.
